info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:47AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Elkhart, western Kosciusko, Cass, La Porte, central White, St. Joseph, Pulaski, Fulton, northwestern Miami, Starke, Marshall, Cass and southeastern Berrien Counties through 745 AM EDT/645 AM CDT/... At 647 AM EDT/547 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Trail Creek to near Winamac to 10 miles southwest of West Lafayette. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Michigan City, La Porte, Winamac and Trail Creek around 655 AM EDT. New Carlisle, Three Oaks and Culver around 705 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Plymouth, Buchanan, Argos, Bourbon, Berrien Springs, Niles, Bremen, Logansport, Nappanee, Dowagiac, Cassopolis, Wakarusa, Walton, Milford, New Paris and Goshen. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 185 and 186. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 39 and 97. Interstate 94 in Indiana between mile markers 34 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
